subject: Legacy Perl?
header: This week seemed to generate fewer articles than earlier weeks. I can see several days go by without any article on blogs.perl.org
It is also the last day for the early-bird discount of the courses at YAPC::EU

entries.title: BEGIN block - running code during compilation
entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: This might be natural to the seasoned Perl developer but the BEGIN block is powerful.

entries.title: Getting Flickr::API to work on Ubuntu Linux SOLVED
entries.author: jason_froebe

entries.title: JSON in Perl
entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: Which module to use to parse JSON in Perl?

entries.title: END block - running code after the application has ended
entries.author: gabor_szabo

entries.title: Reference found where even-sized list expected
entries.author: sebastian_willing
entries.text: References are not allowed as hash keys. They will be stringified and you'll have a key like this HASH(0x14b7720)

entries.title: Legacy DevOps
entries.author: katie_mclaughlin
entries.text: "We're coming to a point where Perl is legacy." after fixing a bug in a 16 years old monitoring system. (Reddit)

entries.title: The end of Module of the Month
entries.text: Nestoria stopped giving out its monthly award. Apparently they could not find 12 additional CPAN authors among the 563 members of the Perl community on Gratipay worth awarding.

entries.title: Introducing Test::Requires::Git
entries.author: philippe_bruhat
entries.text: Test::Requires::Git offers a simple way to declare which versions of git a test depends on, so that it can be skipped if the available git does not match the specification.

entries.title: Who is testing the tests?
entries.author: sinan_unur
entries.text: Or how to convince Perl it has not loaded a module yet even though it already has.

entries.title: Perl's special not a numbers
entries.author: brian_d_foy
entries.text: Some rally crazy stuff probably you have not heard about Perl either. Introducing NaN and Infinity, two 'numerical' values in Perl that probably no one uses.

entries.title: MetaCPAN Welcomes Liquid Web as a Hosting Sponsor
entries.author: olaf_alders

entries.title: Adventures in Dist::Zilla (among other things)
entries.author: buddy_burden
entries.text: In which you learn that PAUSE isn't using your distname to figure out your module name any more, and you'll also learn how to test your Dist::Zilla plugin.

entries.title: Send more money (in Perl 6)
entries.author: carl_masak
entries.text: The Send more money is a fun exercise for when you are bored, and it is interesting to implement it in software as well. Following the implementation of MJD in Haskell, Masak is showing it in 4 different ways in Perl 6.

entries.title: Porting a very simple script to Perl6
entries.author: thomas_klausner
entries.text: Thomas takes his glorified cp script written in Perl 5 as part of the  Picture-of-the-day toolchain and  converts it to Perl 6 finding out on the way that Perl 6 is usable and it is loading faster than Perl 5 + Moose.
